Well look at this positively: in the exam if there's ever a question about ANT+ you can say it's outdated and suggest alternatives and as a result, show that you've done secondary research on the topic. I don't think the IB is outdated as such, and definitely not for their case study; It's rather giving you a hint about what the questions could be.

I have 3 defenders and 2 of them are Walker and Valencia, and I have Daniels, Snodgrass and Elabdellaoui on the bench in that order so guess whose team is getting a total of 2 points from the defense.

I did one and I'm still not sure how I've done until I get my grade for it. But I had a friend who did it on the Octopus card system in Japan and he probably made the primary data up considering we all live far from Japan but he got an A and I followed how he did his. It's not that tough but it gets boring after a while and you won't feel like writing anymore. I know people who did theirs with their full interest because they did a topic they liked in History or English Literature. Just make sure that you can maintain interest in a topic if you're doing it in ITGS.

WRITING.TITLE: Do you think the Maths HL formula booklet needs more formulas included?
WRITING.TEXT: The Calculus Option barely covers important formulas. It's not that easy to just memorize the formulas, especially for a curriculum like the IB which stresses on all kinds of learning except rote-learning.

Also, make sure you know exactly how to answer paper 2 questions because the questions are the same all the time. Read up on wearable technology for paper 3 and make sure you read the case study thoroughly. Hope you did okay in your IA too
look man it's very hard, almost impossible to get a 7 in ITGS HL, just make sure you know your ITGS terminologies and know how to answer questions, by reading markschemes for previous exams.
I'd also recommend David Paddock for Chemistry SL on Youtube
definitely possible but your topic will be dumbed down and oversimplified like the concentration of acetic acid in different brands of vinegar or something
